chess

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    The Game application takes two players and a Chess Board and starts the game.
    Author:
    Baljit Kaur, Milan Patel

      • getInput

      • makeMove

        public boolean makeMove(Block current,
                        Block dest,
                        Player player,
                        boolean check,
                        java.lang.String move)
        Checks if the current piece color matches the current player color and then executes move.
        Parameters:
        current - The block the piece being moved is currently placed on.
        dest - The block a piece is being moved to.
        player - The player making the move.
        check - Takes false if the move is actually being executed or true if it only for checking if the move results in the King being in check.
        move - String used for possible Pawn promotion.
        Returns:
        boolean Returns true or false based on the success of the move or false if the move was invalid.

      • Check

        public boolean Check(Block King,
                     java.lang.String color,
                     java.lang.Boolean CM)

      • checkMate

        public boolean checkMate(Block Move,
                         Piece P,
                         java.lang.String color)
        Checks if a move results in Checkmate.
        Parameters:
        Move - The block a piece isi being moved to.
        P - The piece being moved.
        color - The color of the piece being moved.
        Returns:
        True if checkmate.

      • mapAndExecute

        public boolean mapAndExecute(Player player,
                             java.lang.String s)
        Takes in Player and user input as a string sets up information for makeMove.
        Parameters:
        player - The player whose turn it is to move.
        s - String received as input from player.
        Returns:
        boolean The result of makeMove method.
